resource.description: We'd probably prefer to use the current method of "Get the Dormant, return the Live" -- i.e. when a user performs a Get on a dormant NHI then the live NHI details are returned instead

note.text: How will that impact the model? 'active' is a boolean element from the core. Sounds like you're describing behaviour - so we can address it there. I'll check with the community...
Agree dormant/live is a seperate issue. The NHI doesn't currently have an concept of an active/inactive record  (an external facing concept anyway...)
It looks like https://www.hl7.org/fhir/patient-definitions.html#Patient.link is the default mechanism for managing linking records.
Yeah - link is the thing that refers to a merged patient - but your comment above suggests that the current system doesn't expose merged records anyway?

resource.description: I think the source of the name is pretty useful to most users of the system so is probably worth including here. We may also want to adjust the "use" codeset to align with the current processes

note.text: Do you think it of general use? No issue with keeping it, but it's new to me...

resource.description: We will likely only support level 4 and level 2 (though we might try to discourage its use) here.

note.text: you mean not 1 & 3? No issue with leaving them in the model though...
lots of discussion about this at the moment...

resource.description: There is some discussion about whether we want to use this going forward or not. It is tied up in discussions about eligibility and the historic population of this data is known to be of low quality
I would imagine we want to keep this as the NHI-only..?

note.text: This is more about the clinical data than governance of the identifier. But I'm not sure of the relevance - or meaning here to tell the truth...

resource.description: Currently the NES contains links to the Organization (mandatory), the Practitioner (optional) and the Facility (Location) (optional)

note.text: So organization makes more sense? We can allow either - GP if you know it, Organization (Practice) otherwise...

resource.description: We currently don't store this nationally in a way that can be generally consumed. It will be worth a discussion about the privacy impacts and data collection methods if we were to publish this information

note.text: This comes into the discussion of whether we have 1 profile for patient or 2. We do need it (IMHO) for general use, even if not stored nationally. It can always be left out if there are privacy concerns, but there are many use cases when the ability to contact the patient is important...

resource.description: We need to track facility as well, though this could be derived from the NES data, so perhaps all that is required here is the general practice the patient is registered against?

note.text: Sounds like Organization is the way to go...

resource.description: Not sure i follow why we will have this attribute?  In NZ, the National NHI register is the source of truth.  So unless we potentially have records from other jurisdictions does this add any value at this time?
Wouldn't this be a mandatory field?

note.text: Probably depends on the context - an ED or ambulance IT system likely wants to be able to create a record (within their system) without necessarily knowing this. Cardinality differences might be another reason to have a base profile and NHI specific one?
Agree. I think this model will evolve into an NHI one - then we can have the debate about what should be included in core...

resource.description: Why is this structure different to the "birthdate" attribute structure?

note.text: Good question. It probably shouldn't. In both cases the source will be an extension on the underlying value. I'll fix...

resource.description: Hmm.  We should be returning the live record if the query was for a non-live NHI.  But this goes against all the advice from a data leakage perspective so perhaps we need to rethink how this is done.

note.text: It's also kinda weird from a pure REST perspective - ask for something, get something else back...   And what about historical type queries?

resource.description: Shouldn't name be a mandatory field?  The same with a few other attributes listed here as optional (birthdate for example).

note.text: If this is not the core (but the NHI) then it shoiuld be...

resource.description: This seems like one that's relevent to a base profile but won't be used by the NHI profile.

There's a question of usage here- is the expectation that a phone number on the NHI is added to a record for 'identity purposes' or as a contact (and if so, contact for what purpose and who isn't allowed to use it / what context). 

As the NHI is a national system used by many organisations we need to be careful that information provided for one purpose or in one context is appropriate / permitted to be used in another- otherwise it probably should be left off the model.

note.text: But as a base profile fieild it probably makes perfect sense to include...
so out in NHi, In in core...
